exercises.name: Head Mobilization
steps: Position a small ball on your temple, next to your eye, and apply pressure
To take up the soft tissue slack in your face spin the ball into your head
Pressuring the ball into your head, open and close your mouth, raise your eyebrows, and make circles with your eyes

exercises.name: Jaw Mobilization
steps: Position a ball on your jaw joint, or on the muscles of your jaw right in front of your ear
Maintaining steady pressure, twist your hand. Move your jaw up and down and side to side
You can also clench your teeth to contract and then relaxe, pressing the ball deeper into the muscle

exercises.name: Anteriror Neck Mobilization
steps: Tilt your head to the side, pin a ball to the side of your neck, and apply pressure
While pressing the ball into your neck, bind up the tissue by twisting the ball in place
Tilt your head away from the ball and move your head in different directions. Remember, the target area runs from your jaw down to your collarbone and around the front of your neck

exercises.name: Posterior Neck Mobilization
steps: Lying on your back, position a large ball in the center of your skull. You will feel a small pocket. Place one hand on your forehead to add pressure
Slowly rotate your head to the side, rolling the ball along the base of your skull to your ear
Turn your head to the opposite side, scouring the entire base of your skull
To add even more pressure, cross your other arm over your forehead grabbing the front of your forearm with your bottom hand

exercises.name: Anterior Hip Smash
steps: Position a large ball on your hip flexor.
Contract and relax or flex and extend your lower leg
You can alos smash and floss by curling your heel toward your butt and moving leg from side to side
Or you can pressure wave across your help flexor area by rotating his from side to side

exercises.name: Classic Hip Extension
steps: Kneel on ground, distributing weight over your grounded knee
Maintaining a neutral spinal position, squeeze your butt and shift your weight forward
Don't overextend at the low back as you open your hips by keeping your butt squeezed, keeping abs on tension and focus shifting your weight forward over your grounded knee
From here you can contract or relax your 'stretched' thigh to sink deeper into the movement.
To increase the intensity and tap into your high hip stiffness, bring your left arm over your head (if your left knee is on the ground), lean back (but do not arch), and then come back to center.

exercises.name: Anteriror Neck Mobilization
steps: Tilt your head to the side, pin a ball to the side of your neck, and apply pressure
While pressing the ball into your neck, bind up the tissue by twisting the ball in place
Tilt your head away from the ball and move your head in different directions. Remember, the target area runs from your jaw down to your collarbone and around the front of your neck

exercises.name: Posterior Neck Mobilization
steps: Lying on your back, position a large ball in the center of your skull. You will feel a small pocket. Place one hand on your forehead to add pressure
Slowly rotate your head to the side, rolling the ball along the base of your skull to your ear
Turn your head to the opposite side, scouring the entire base of your skull
To add even more pressure, cross your other arm over your forehead grabbing the front of your forearm with your bottom hand
